Interface ec.id.capabilities.WhereisCapabilityHandler

Implementing Classes:
PalaceWhereisCapabilityImpl, WhereisCapabilityHandlerImpl
public abstract interface WhereisCapabilityHandler
extends Serializable
Interface for handler for whereis information. Implementers of this interface will have their 'whereIsOwner' method when the remote WhereisCapability 'whereAreYou' method is called. An implementer of this interface must be provided to the WhereisCapability upon construction, so that when the WhereisCapability is remotely called, it can turn around and call the object implementing this interface to actually get the current whereis state. So objects implementing this interface and passed to the WhereisCapability then determine the response to the 'whereAreYou' remote capability.

Author:
Scott B. Lewis, slewis@communities.com
See Also:
WhereisCapability

Method Summary
String whereIsOwner(ID senderID)
          Method called to actually determine the response to a whereAreYou request to the WhereisCapability instance.
 

Method Detail

whereIsOwner

public String whereIsOwner(ID senderID)
Method called to actually determine the response to a whereAreYou request to the WhereisCapability instance. This method is called by the WhereisCapability instance, in response to a 'whereAreYou' message. The implementer of this method is responsible for getting and returning the actual value to be given back in response to the 'whereAreYou' message. A return value of null means that the owner of this object does not wish to divulge its current location.
Parameters:
senderID - the ID of the object that the WhereisCapability was initially given to
